Point.name: Point
Point.description: A simple 2D point on a plane

params.name: x
params.description: X coordinate of the point

params.name: y
params.description: Y coordinate of the point

params.name: x
params.description: X component of the Vector

params.name: y
params.description: Y component of the Vector

Template.name: Template
Template.description:
Excalibur's built in templating class, it is a loadable that will load
and html fragment from a url. Excalibur templating is very basic only
allowing bindings of the type data-text="this.obj.someprop", 
data-style="color:this.obj.color.toString()". Bindings allow all valid
javascript expressions.

params.name: path
params.description: Location of the html template

Binding.name: Binding
Binding.description:
Excalibur's binding library that allows you to bind an html
template to the dom given a certain context. Excalibur bindings are only updated
when the update() method is called

params.name: parentElementId
params.description: The id of the element in the dom to attach the template binding

params.name: template
params.description: The template you wish to bind

params.name: ctx
params.description: The context of the binding, which can be any object

ICollidable.name: ICollidable
ICollidable.description: Interface all collidable objects must implement

BoundingBox.name: BoundingBox
BoundingBox.description: Axis Aligned collision primitive for Excalibur.

params.name: left
params.description: x coordinate of the left edge

params.name: top
params.description: y coordinate of the top edge

params.name: right
params.description: x coordinate of the right edge

params.name: bottom
params.description: y coordinate of the bottom edge

Camera.name: Camera
Camera.description: A base implementation of a camera. This class is meant to be extended.

params.name: engine
params.description: Reference to the current engine

SideCamera.name: SideCamera
SideCamera.description: An extension of Camera that is locked vertically; it will only move side to side.

params.name: engine
params.description: Reference to the current engine

TopCamera.name: TopCamera
TopCamera.description: An extension of Camera that is locked to an actor or focal point; the actor will appear in the center of the screen.

params.name: engine
params.description: Reference to the current engine

Cell.name: Cell
Cell.description:
A light-weight object that occupies a space in a collision map. Generally
created by a CollisionMap.

CollisionMap.name: CollisionMap
CollisionMap.description:
The CollisionMap object provides a lightweight way to do large complex scenes with collision
without the overhead of actors.

params.name: x
params.description: The x coordinate to anchor the collision map's upper left corner (should not be changed once set)

params.name: y
params.description: The y coordinate to anchor the collision map's upper left corner (should not be changed once set)

params.name: cellWidth
params.description: The individual width of each cell (in pixels) (should not be changed once set)

params.name: cellHeight
params.description: The individual height of each cell (in pixels) (should not be changed once set)

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of rows in the collision map (should not be changed once set)

params.name: cols
params.description: The number of cols in the collision map (should not be changed once set)

params.name: spriteSheet
params.description: The spriteSheet to use for drawing

Color.name: Color
Color.description: Creates a new instance of Color from an r, g, b, a

params.name: r
params.description: The red component of color (0-255)

params.name: g
params.description: The green component of color (0-255)

params.name: b
params.description: The blue component of color (0-255)

params.name: a
params.description: The alpha component of color (0-1.0)

DisplayMode.name: DisplayMode
DisplayMode.description: Enum representing the different display modes available to Excalibur

Timer.name: Timer
Timer.description: The Excalibur timer hooks into the internal timer and fires callbacks, after a certain interval, optionally repeating.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback to be fired after the interval is complete.

params.name: repeats
params.description: Indicates whether this call back should be fired only once, or repeat after every interval as completed.

Engine.name: Engine
Engine.description:
The 'Engine' is the main driver for a game. It is responsible for 
starting/stopping the game, maintaining state, transmitting events, 
loading resources, and managing the scene.

params.name: width
params.description: The width in pixels of the Excalibur game viewport

params.name: height
params.description: The height in pixels of the Excalibur game viewport

params.name: canvasElementId
params.description: If this is not specified, then a new canvas will be created and inserted into the body.

params.name: displayMode
params.description: If this is not specified, then it will fall back to fixed if a height and width are specified, else the display mode will be FullScreen.

IDrawable.name: IDrawable
IDrawable.description: Interface for implementing anything in Excalibur that can be drawn to the screen.

SpriteSheet.name: SpriteSheet
SpriteSheet.description:
SpriteSheets are a useful mechanism for slicing up image resources into
separate sprites or for generating in game animations. Sprites are organized
in row major order in the SpriteSheet.

params.name: image
params.description: The backing image texture to build the SpriteSheet

params.name: columns
params.description: The number of columns in the image texture

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of rows in the image texture

params.name: spWidth
params.description: The width of each individual sprite in pixels

params.name: spHeight
params.description: The height of each individual sprite in pixels

SpriteFont.name: SpriteFont
SpriteFont.description:
SpriteFonts are a used in conjunction with a {{#crossLink Label}}{{/crossLink}} to specify
a particular bitmap as a font.

params.name: image
params.description: The backing image texture to build the SpriteFont

params.name: alphabet
params.description: A string representing all the charaters in the image, in row major order.

params.name: caseInsensitve
params.description: Indicate whether this font takes case into account

params.name: columns
params.description: The number of columns of characters in the image

params.name: rows
params.description: The number of rows of characters in the image

params.name: spWdith
params.description: The width of each character in pixels

params.name: spHeight
params.description: The height of each character in pixels

ISpriteEffect.name: ISpriteEffect
ISpriteEffect.description: The interface that all sprite effects must implement

Effects.Grayscale.name: Effects.Grayscale
Effects.Grayscale.description: Applies the "Grayscale" effect to a sprite, removing color information.

Effects.Invert.name: Effects.Invert
Effects.Invert.description: Applies the "Invert" effect to a sprite, inverting the pixel colors.

Effects.Opacity.name: Effects.Opacity
Effects.Opacity.description: Applies the "Opacity" effect to a sprite, setting the alpha of all pixels to a given value.

params.name: opacity
params.description: The new opacity of the sprite from 0-1.0

Effects.Colorize.name: Effects.Colorize
Effects.Colorize.description:
Applies the "Colorize" effect to a sprite, changing the color channels of all the pixels to an 
average of the original color and the provided color

params.name: color
params.description: The color to apply to the sprite

Effects.Fill.name: Effects.Fill
Effects.Fill.description:
Applies the "Fill" effect to a sprite, changing the color channels of all non-transparent pixels to match
a given color

params.name: color
params.description: The color to apply to the sprite

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description:
A Sprite is one of the main drawing primitives. It is responsible for drawing
images or parts of images known as Textures to the screen.

params.name: image
params.description: The backing image texture to build the Sprite

params.name: sx
params.description: The x position of the sprite

params.name: sy
params.description: The y position of the sprite

params.name: swidth
params.description: The width of the sprite in pixels

params.name: sheight
params.description: The height of the sprite in pixels

Animation.name: Animation
Animation.description:
Animations allow you to display a series of images one after another,
creating the illusion of change. Generally these images will come from a sprite sheet source.

params.name: engine
params.description: Reference to the current game engine

params.name: images
params.description: An array of sprites to create the frames for the animation

params.name: speed
params.description: The number in milliseconds to display each frame in the animation

params.name: loop
params.description: Indicates whether the animation should loop after it is completed

Polygon.name: Polygon
Polygon.description: Creates a closed polygon drawing given a list a of points. Polygons should be used sparingly as there is a performance impact for using them.

params.name: points
params.description: The points to use to build the polygon in order

Scene.name: Scene
Scene.description:
Actors are composed together into groupings called Scenes in 
Excalibur. The metaphor models the same idea behind real world 
actors in a scene. Only actors in scenes will be updated and drawn.

Side.name: Side
Side.description: An enum that describes the sides of an Actor for collision

CollisionType.name: CollisionType
CollisionType.description: An enum that describes the types of collisions actors can participate in

Actor.name: Actor
Actor.description: The most important primitive in Excalibur is an "Actor." Anything that can move on the screen, collide with another Actor, respond to events, or interact with the current scene, must be an actor. An Actor must be part of a {{#crossLink "Scene"}}{{/crossLink}} for it to be drawn to the screen.

params.name: x
params.description: The starting x coordinate of the actor

params.name: y
params.description: The starting y coordinate of the actor

params.name: width
params.description: The starting width of the actor

params.name: height
params.description: The starting height of the actor

params.name: color
params.description: The starting color of the actor

TextAlign.name: TextAlign
TextAlign.description: Enum representing the different horizontal text alignments

BaseAlign.name: BaseAlign
BaseAlign.description: Enum representing the different baseline text alignments

Label.name: Label
Label.description:
Labels are the way to draw small amounts of text to the screen in Excalibur. They are
actors and inherit all of the benifits and capabilities.

params.name: text
params.description: The text of the label

params.name: x
params.description: The x position of the label

params.name: y
params.description: The y position of the label

params.name: font
params.description: Use any valid css font string for the label's font. Default is "10px sans-serif".

params.name: spriteFont
params.description: Use an Excalibur sprite font for the label's font, if a SpriteFont is provided it will take precendence over a css font.

Trigger.name: Trigger
Trigger.description:
Triggers a method of firing arbitrary code on collision. These are useful
as 'buttons', 'switches', or to trigger effects in a game. By defualt triggers
are invisible, and can only be seen with debug mode enabled on the Engine.

params.name: x
params.description: The x position of the trigger

params.name: y
params.description: The y position of the trigger

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the trigger

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the trigger

params.name: action
params.description: Callback to fire when trigger is activated

params.name: repeats
params.description: The number of times that this trigger should fire, by default it is 1, if -1 is supplied it will fire indefinitely

EventType.name: EventType
EventType.description: An enum representing all of the built in event types for Excalibur

GameEvent.name: GameEvent
GameEvent.description: Base event type in Excalibur that all other event types derive from.

params.name: target
params.description: Events can have target game object, like the Engine, or an Actor.

FocusEvent.name: FocusEvent
FocusEvent.description: Event received by the Engine when the browser window receives focus

BlurEvent.name: BlurEvent
BlurEvent.description: Event received by the Engine when the browser window is blurred

CollisionEvent.name: CollisionEvent
CollisionEvent.description: Event thrown on an actor when a collision has occured

params.name: actor
params.description: The actor the event was thrown on

params.name: other
params.description: The actor that was collided with

params.name: side
params.description: The side that was collided with

UpdateEvent.name: UpdateEvent
UpdateEvent.description: Event thrown on a game object on Excalibur update

params.name: delta
params.description: The number of milliseconds since the last update

InitializeEvent.name: InitializeEvent
InitializeEvent.description: Event thrown on an Actor only once before the first update call

params.name: engine
params.description: The reference to the current engine

ActivateEvent.name: ActivateEvent
ActivateEvent.description: Event thrown on a Scene on activation

params.name: oldScene
params.description: The reference to the old scene

DeactivateEvent.name: DeactivateEvent
DeactivateEvent.description: Event thrown on a Scene on deactivation

params.name: newScene
params.description: The reference to the new scene

ExitViewPortEvent.name: ExitViewPortEvent
ExitViewPortEvent.description: Event thrown on an Actor when it completely leaves the screen.

EnterViewPortEvent.name: EnterViewPortEvent
EnterViewPortEvent.description: Event thrown on an Actor when it completely leaves the screen.

KeyEvent.name: KeyEvent
KeyEvent.description: Event thrown on a game object on KeyEvent

params.description: The key responsible for throwing the event

EventDispatcher.name: EventDispatcher
EventDispatcher.description: Excalibur's internal queueing event dispatcher. Callbacks are queued up and not fired until the update is called.

params.name: target
params.description: The object that will be the recipient of events from this event dispatcher

ILoadable.name: ILoadable
ILoadable.description: An interface describing loadable resources in Excalibur

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
The Texture object allows games built in Excalibur to load image resources.
It is generally recommended to preload images using the "Texture" object.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to the image resource

Sound.name: Sound
Sound.description:
The Sound object allows games built in Excalibur to load audio 
components, from soundtracks to sound effects. It is generally 
recommended to load sound resources when using Excalibur

params.name: ...paths
params.description: A list of audio sources (clip.wav, clip.mp3, clip.ogg) for this audio clip. This is done for browser compatibility.

Loader.name: Loader
Loader.description:
The loader provides a mechanism to preload multiple resources at 
one time. The loader must be passed to the engine in order to 
trigger the loading progress bar

params.name: loadables
params.description: Optionally provide the list of resources you want to load at constructor time

LogLevel.name: LogLevel
LogLevel.description: Logging level that Excalibur will tag

Logger.name: Logger
Logger.description:
Static singleton that represents the logging facility for Excalibur.
Excalibur comes built-in with a ConsoleAppender and ScreenAppender.
Derive from IAppender to create your own logging appenders.

IAppender.name: IAppender
IAppender.description: Contract for any log appender (such as console/screen)

params.name: width
params.description: Width of the screen appender in pixels

params.name: height
params.description: Height of the screen appender in pixels

EmitterType.name: EmitterType
EmitterType.description: An enum that represents the types of emitter nozzles

ParticleEmitter.name: ParticleEmitter
ParticleEmitter.description:
Using a particle emitter is a great way to create interesting effects 
in your game, like smoke, fire, water, explosions, etc. Particle Emitters
extend Actor allowing you to use all of the features that come with Actor

params.name: x
params.description: The x position of the emitter

params.name: y
params.description: The y position of the emitter

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the emitter

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the emitter

PromiseState.name: PromiseState
PromiseState.description: Valid states for a promise to be in

params.name: initialSize
params.description: Initial size of the internal backing array

classitems.description:
Actors with the PreventCollision setting do not participate in any
collisions and do not raise collision events.
classitems.name: PreventCollision

classitems.description:
Actors with the Passive setting only raise collision events, but are not
influenced or moved by other actors and do not influence or move other actors.
classitems.name: Passive

classitems.description:
Actors with the Active setting raise collision events and participate
in collisions with other actors and will be push or moved by actors sharing
the Active or Fixed setting.
classitems.name: Active

classitems.description:
Actors with the Elastic setting will behave the same as Active, except that they will
"bounce" in the opposite direction given their velocity dx/dy. This is a naive implementation meant for
prototyping, for a more robust elastic collision listen to the "collision" event and perform your custom logic.
classitems.name: Elastic

classitems.description:
Actors with the Fixed setting raise collision events and participate in
collisions with other actors. Actors with the Fixed setting will not be
pushed or moved by other actors sharing the Fixed or Actors. Think of Fixed
actors as "immovable/onstoppable" objects. If two Fixed actors meet they will
not be pushed or moved by each other, they will not interact except to throw
collision events.
classitems.name: Fixed
